text: Welcome to another episode of Explain using discover to find and benchmark AI models.
Discover allows you to use natural language input to browse, test and benchmark MTT models from an ever expanding selection of providers.
In this demo I'm going to focus on an Arabic to English translation workflow.
We can see here that there are currently 4 providers at different price points to choose from.
We can click on the information icon to review a model in more detail.
In this case, we can see that the provider of this model is Google, at a cost of 20 credits per million characters.
I could enable this model from here, but first I'd like to run a benchmark to determine which provider might be the best fit for my use case.
I'm going to select one model from each of the pricing tiers for comparison.
You'll notice that our benchmarking function and language pairs are prepopulated from our initial search.
All I need to do is provide an Arabic data sample and then run my benchmark.
You'll notice the benchmarking times can vary depending on the characteristics of the specific model selected.
And here we go. I can now see comparison samples of our translated text, as well as a range of scores from a selection of popular machine translation evaluation models.
In this case I'm going to focus on class scores where higher scores are better, and I'm looking to find the best price performance option available.
This looks like the perfect model match for my purposes, so I'm going to enable it in my account.
You'll notice a heads up display here that our model has been saved in the dashboard.
And there it is.
OK, let's click the setting gear icon in our model preview pane to view our usability features.
Here you'll find your model endpoint, a URL where the model can be accessed and an access key.
An API key to authenticate your model access. There are also Java and Python code snippets that can be integrated into any of your custom applications.
As a member, you'll have full access to all of these features and more. Visit explain to begin your own AI discovery.
